Details: Applied in fields and storage to reduce rot and fungal spread.
Added to planting hills; thought to prevent both insects and blight.
Treated seed tubers before planting, an early form of modern fungicide.
Observed higher disease in heavily manured fields; adjustments made to fertilization practices.
Tubers stored in dry sand or ash to prevent moisture-induced rot in storage.
Used to deter insects, based on belief that pests were carriers of the disease.
Sprinkled over plants to inhibit fungal growth, based on traditional agricultural practices.
